ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: The Khadi & Village Industries Association is a registered voluntary organization, registered under Indian Societies Registration Act 1860. The Khadi & V.I. Association was established in the year 1992. Objectives The broad objectives that the Khadi Association has set before it are: 1 The social objectives of providing employment, 2 the economic objective of producing saleable articles, and 3 the wider objective of creating self-reliance amongst the people and building up a strong rural community spirit. Functions The Association is charged with the functions of planning, promotion, organization and implementation of programs for the development of khadi & other village industries in the rural areas in coordination with other agencies engaged in rural development. Its functions also comprise building up of a reserve of raw materials & implements for supply to artisans, creation of common service facilities for processing of raw materials as semi-finished goods & provisions of facilities for marketing of KVI products apart from organization of training of artisans engaged at the micro/Marco level & encouragement of co-operative efforts amongst them. To promote the sales and marketing of khadi or products of V.I. or handicrafts, the Association may forge linkages with established marketing agencies. Balwadi cum Nutrition programme in the village Lalapur, District Allahabad. This Centre, with the help of playing materials, cartoons, indoor games etc. create healthy environment, creativity and awareness against the prevalent social evils, amongst the children. ngoList.title: The Palaeontological Society of India
ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Activities of the Society The Palaeontological Society of India was formed with the main aim of promoting and popularization of palaeontology. (1) Publications The Society publishes a research journal biannually which is of international standard with 0.47 impact factor. In this journal original scientific papers are published. Besides journal, it has published five Field guide books, Six Special publications three monographs and one atlas. (2) Lectures Society has started three lecture series in the memory of eminent geoscientists of the country. These are held annually, namely Prof. M.R. Sahni Memorial Lecture, Prof. R.C. Misra Memorial Lecture and Prof. S.N. Singh Memorial Lecture. In these Lectures, geoscientist from India and abroad are invited to deliver lectures to inspire young research scholars and to popularise palaeontology in general. (3) Medals To encourage students / research scientists, Society has instituted six Gold Medals which are regularly awarded to encourage palaeontological researches. These Medals are: 1. Prof. M.R. Sahni Gold Medal, awarded every year to the P.G. student of Lucknow University, who secures highest percentage of marks in Palaeontology paper. 2. Prof. S.N. Bhalla commemorative Medal awarded alternate years to scientists for outstanding research work in Micropalaeontology. 3. Sharda Chandra Gold Medal awarded every year for meritorious research paper published in palaeontology on Indian material (Annually). 4. Mani Shanker Shukla Gold Medal for out standing research in Micropalaeontology to Scientists below 35 years (Annually). 5. Prof. R.C. Misra Memorial Life Time Achievement Award A Gold Medal for outstanding contributions in Geosciences (Annually). 6. Prof. S.K. Singh Memorial Gold Medal for best research paper published in the Journal of the Palaeontological Society of India (Annually). 4. Field Workshops and Seminars Society organizes Seminars, Symposia Brainstorming Sessions, and National and International Field Workshops. Till date Society has organized four International Field Workshops. The Society has organized four International Field Workshops, two National workshops on Palaeontological and Biostratigraphical aspects. 5. Palaeontological Library Palaeontological Society has established a library from research journals received in exchange from number of countries namely South Africa, Peoples Republic of China, Poland etc. (M. P. Singh)

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Unnayan Foundation Trust has been created with the objective of empowering the weaker section of the society in general and women in particular. In consonance with these aims and objectives major category-wise charitable activities being carried out by the Trust are as follows â€“ [A] STUDENT SPONSORSHIP PROGRAMME In consonance with the objectives enshrined in the deed of the Trust which provides for grant of scholarships for poor, deserving and needy students for elementary, middle and higher education, Unnayan decided to sponsor formal education of 6 girls and 2 boys from very poor families in order to support them build their future. [B] UNNAYAN ADOPTS VILLAGE UTTARDHAUNA IN LUCKNOW DISTRICT To provide relief to the poor and in order to improve health, education and economic condition of villagers in general and for empowering the women of the village in particular, Unnayan has adopted Village Uttardhauna in Lucknow district to bring it up as a model village in terms of an empowered women community and a self dependent village. Unnayan has intervened to make the women of the village empowered through improved health, education and nutrition. To achieve this aim, we are focusing on key issues - women education, healthcare, hygiene, nutrition, skill development and formation of self-help groups. Apart from making them aware of the necessity of these basic amenities of a dignified human life, regular adult schools and health camps are being organized. [C] ADULT EDUCATION & LITERACY CLASSES & WOMEN EMPOWERMENT: 1. To empower the women, adult education programme is being run in Village Uttardhauna. About 150 women were distributed free of cost adult education kits. Regular literacy classes are being held in the Panchayat Ghar of the village for the women of Uttardhauna. 2. The enthusiasm that these women of the village have shown has resulted into most of the illiterate women becoming literate enough to read and write and calculate their expenses. 3. Besides these, women are also being taught things for living a quality life. 4. Most of the women who were illiterate and ignorant are now willingly involved in the process of transforming themselves into being literate, having learnt to read, write and communicate effectively. 5. Our biggest achievement has been to successfully motivate women of all ages to strive for a better life by becoming more aware of the surroundings and by learning to read and write, at minimum. [D] HEALTH CAMPS & EYE CAMPS: In order to improve the health conditions of the villagers, 03 major health camps have been organized by Unnayan in village Utthardhauna. Doctors of major specialities attended these camps. Facilities for free ECG check up, blood test and free eye test were made available. All patients were distributed medicines free of cost and power glasses have also been provided free of cost to them. [E] EMPLOYMENT & WOMEN EMPOWERMENT: Unnayan has supported 4 women volunteers to assist in the literacy programme being conducted in Uttardhauna for which they are paid honorarium making them self-dependent.
